Reviews.Title: “great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Lovez2travel_11
Reviews.Content: I was really worried about staying here after reading some of these reviews but what a pleasant surprise. Clean spacious room over 2 levels overlooking a beautiful courtyard. Polite, helpful staff. Bathroom tiny but clean. Breakfast plain but adequate. 2 minute walk to tube, bars and restaurants Fantastic value, especially for London

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again :(”
Reviews.Author: Wanabe_Wanderers
Reviews.Content: Late writing this review (took us that long to get over the place!)... Stayed there at end of March 2011.. Thought it was cheap for London, but to be honest it's not cheap enough to ever get us to stay there again.. Room and bedding was not clean, shower and toilet awful... The breakfast? Well, even though we paid for a week we only went down there once to eat, left without eating anything and never entered that dining room again... Couldn't cope with staying there for the full week even though we had paid in advance!! We found other accommodation asap and left early... On the positive side the staff were nice enough... Overall we did not get what we paid for, even by London standards!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Dave W
Reviews.Content: If I'd paid £20 a night for this I'd have felt robbed. The room was filthy, the furniture damaged, no chair for the 'writing desk', the curtains don't cover the windows and you can't shut the door if you want to use the toilet in the plastic 'en suite'. Breakfast if you are lucky enough to get served consists of 'toast with eggs fried'. Shocking, and an embarrasment to London ahead of the Olympics. Unfortunately Trip Adviser won't let me score it as zero, otherwise I would.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty room and the worst breakfast in my life(((”
Reviews.Author: cookie102
Reviews.Content: Very dirty room and the worst breakfast in my life.I was there first and last time.Photos in internet are diferent than I saw in "hotel".I"ll never back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Forsy05
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and have stayed in our fair share of budget hotels, this one is our 2nd worst ever. We booked through booking.com and there are some good reviews on there, these are not to be believed and I would question if they were written by genuine travelers. The communal area outside our room smelt of urine, thankfully our room had a window which was open as it was warm during our stay so the air was better in there. We left the window open to keep the air fresh and also because we scared of closing it, the pane of glass was cracked and the rotten sashes looked like if you tried to move it the whole thing might just fall out. The bed was not a full size double (I doubt the room would fit one) and as it was pushed up to the window with no room at the bottom it meant that my partner had to climb over me if he needed the loo in the middle of the night, not good for me or him. The bathroom was tiny, it was not possible to close the door whilst on the toilet and you literally had one foot in the shower, it was so small that you couldn't re-dress in there and had to negotiate the step from the cubicle with your trousers around your ankles and re-dress in the room, the basin was very old and surrounding areas were dirty. Don't be deceived by the pictures, it does look very nice from the outside but the inside is another world altogether, that's said the location was fantastic, I would stay in this area again but NOT AT THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gross Gross Gross! Believe the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Keefe F
Reviews.Content: I'm like a lot of people and I only review when I have something bad to say about a place, but if you do contemplate staying here please believe these reviews.The place is a complete cesspit! I stayed one night and believe me it was one night too long. I'm also a student so I am used to staying in some pretty grim places. The reception looked clean and was a nice area to be in, then as soon as you crossed through the door leading to the rooms it was like crossing into the land that time and cleanliness forgot. Luckily I had a cold and therefore no sense of smell but I was informed by my sister that it did in fact smell When we got to our room we were speechless, it was dark, tiny and disgusting. The carpet had some interesting grime piles and the walls had black marks or possibly holes in (to be honest I didnt fancy taking a loser look I felt ignorance was bliss). The bathroom was so small that you couldn't shut the door when you sat down to do your buisness,and you had to check no one could see you as you did a lovely little jig whilst trying to wipe and maintain some dignity, The shower was a bit of a let down. It was lukewarm, about as powerful as being dribbled on, and for some reason I couldnt coax the shower head into pointing towards me I did try to fiddle with it but it looked close to falling out the wall so I felt it best to leave it alone. The bed's were nicely made but I was only brave enough to peel back one the throw when I spotted something that looked disturbingly like nibble marks on my blanket. I presume that one of the guests had already experienced the taste sensation that was the "breakfast" and felt it was wise to fill upon the bedding before tackling that mornings brekkie. I refer to breakfast as a taste sensation because my egg did have taste but left me with a nauseous sensation. But the young lady who served us was lovely and smiley. If your thinking of staying please just take my advice and dont.

Reviews.Title: “never ever”
Reviews.Author: ruda55
Reviews.Content: I got bedroom B03 with my boyfriend. Someone already write sth about it. I paid 100 pounds for not comfortable bed, blocked sink and noise from underground... I know that London is not cheap but for 100 £ i will get sth lots better. What i can say- if you have any other choise dont go in there....

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: mikipare
Reviews.Content: Because of my job, I travel a lot. This is the worst hotel that I ve ever stayed!!! Not clean, small rooms, prefabric wc, unfriendly reception-management, uncomfortable beds, dirty bed covers, mouldy breads at breakfast, etc...It is at nortfolk square, there are many other nice places to stay. But not this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, grimy flea pit! DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: xResist
Reviews.Content: What a SH**HOLE! seriously this place is a dump! looks nice from the outside & maybe reception, but don't judge a book by its cover! It was tiny, dirty, grimy, filthy and very HOT! the fan in my room was so loud it sounded like a plane ready to take off so i didn't put it on..instead i had to sit and sweat. Paint peeling & chipping off everywhere, dirty plates & laundry left on all the stairways, dirty bathroom, miniscule oven room.. If you've ever been to a hotel in a third world country this is what it compares to. DO NOT STAY HERE!..EVER!

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhillGray
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for two nights in early July 2011 after exhausting our search for a hotel in London with access to Hyde Park. This was literally the only hotel we could find. We paid up considerably more than i would have liked for a hotel of this class and booked a double room. Upon arrival our card was charged and only after we'd paid our £220 were we informed that the double room we'd booked was not available. We then were given two single rooms (as two guys i'm not suprised at their backwards reaction, but irritated that i didnt challenge them at the time). On two different floors, and with one ensuite and one single with shared bathroom we were appalled at our accommodation (tired, dated, crumbling). Needless to say we didnt challenge them as we were exhausted from travelling. We changed and went straight out. Throughout our stay i was very consicous of the security (or feeling of a lack thereof). Breakfast on the first day was appalling: arriving at the downstairs breakfast room were we're nodded at to take a seat and my partner was given a plate of eggs and toast - no asking what he wanted, just given it. (It seemed that someone had ordered it and then changed their mind so the lady placed in front of him. I had plain toast and had to ask for preserves and butter). Disgusting was the only word i can use. Appalling service, appalling hotel - i cannot say to you strongly enought to NEVER use this hotel in its current state.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Russyork
Reviews.Content: Having booked a double room for a weekend in London we arrived and were pleased with the location and setting. It seemed pleasant enough from the outside. Booking had been tricky as the hotel had messed up my credit card numbers and threatened to cancel my reservation with one days notice. They sorted it eventually however it was not a very secure method of payment. On arrival, I was then asked for my card again and charged the full price of the room (£220 for two nights I might add!) when I questioned that I had already given my card details the man at the reception said they had taken one nights payment as a deposit and then needed the full amount (essentially meaning the room cost £330 over the weekend) and leaving me short of spending in money. To add insult to injury, having paid for the room, the reception then informed us that they had no double rooms available and that we would be staying in separate single rooms on different floors. So much for a romantic weekend away. As two men travelling together I assume they thought we wouldn't mind however I was really disappointed that we didn't get the double room I'd booked. I would at least have expected them to tell us before we arrived let alone before they took payment. The rooms were cramped but clean however the bathrooms were tiny and barely usable. The shower was a dribble and leaked all over the room. There was water dripping through a light fitting from the room above in one of the bathrooms. Breakfast was terrible. The staff spoke no English and did not understand the orders that people were making. An extra portion of breakfast had been made for another table so it was plonked unceremoniously in front of me. 'Breakfast' was an omelette and three pieces of dry toast. You had to ask for condiments and these came in dishes that had clearly been out on tables then topped up and put back in the fridge. The breakfast room had fewer seats than the capacity of the hotel and people had to queue outside to wait for breakfast. All in all it was a bit of a disaster and I can't recommend you avoid this hotel enough unless you are desperate for a room. I wish I had read the reviews on here before I booked!

Reviews.Title: “Will not recomende”
Reviews.Author: reiseglad11
Reviews.Content: Will not stay here again. it was dirty and smelt badly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible ! never go there !”
Reviews.Author: totomangesasoupe
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay some days in London for tourism and shopping and booked an Hotel via web site "easy-to-book" .. first mistake. This website is linked to 'hotel solutions direct' that takes ANY booking for ANY hotel even without agreement with this hotel. Then they just start finding a room in replacement, in the surroundings. You do not know that until you show at the first booked hotel and be answered "no reservation for you". You call [-], online help who simply says you are redirected in another hotel, you have not chosen. If the replacement hotel is fine, why not .... same price .... but in my case, not same quality - or better, no quality at all. New hotel seems nice from outside, we have to pay in advance for the two nights (fee amount increased because of card payment) and received the key .... Room is in the basement, a small window covered transparent plastic in the deep of an internal courtyard not, possible to see the sky, courtyard full of pigeon droppings. Room surface does not extent 8 square meters , including shower and WC. General state horrible, humidity, missing paint, holes in blanket, paint on blanket, I had to turn the mattress to feel better when laid down... and so on. Please have a look at pictures, from the nice hotel publicity to the reality. I asked for another room and have been answered the manager in not there but will be in the hotel the day after .... not possible to join of course. After the first night in this cellar, the receptionist agreed to find a solution that never came .... being back at the hotel at 6:00 pm, we have been said the room is still ours. Receptionist has no solution, the manager is not reachable et impossible to cancel the second night, no reimbursement possible. Hotel solutions direct has been asked for help ... thye promised to call me back .... I am still waiting .... Screwed .... On top of that, underground lines at so close that each 2 minutes you feel a train enters your room. Possibility to sleep from 1.00 to 4.00 .... no train during that time. Should you book via internet, I suggest you ban the " [-] " should you receive a confirmation from them cancel if as soon as possible and jump to the next web site....; and the most important, please avoid "hide park court hotel ...."

Reviews.Title: “The soothing sound of the underground while you sleep”
Reviews.Author: swansea_wales_87
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I opted for the Hyde Park Court purely because of its location and price. It's no secret that accomodation in London is a little bit on the expensive side so when we saw this hotel for just £50 a night (including breakfast) it just made sense. And the fact that it's just a three-four minute walk to Paddington made it even more appealing, especially as we didn't roll into the station until nearly 9pm. As stated in other reviews the recpetion area at the Hyde Park Court is plush compared the rest of the hotel. You walk in and are greeted by a member of staff on reception; check-in was extremely quick and we were told that our room (B03) was downstairs - crossing the threshold and into a timewarp which sends you back to decour and furniture which resembles that of the 1970s. But it was clean - contrary to what others have said - with the only signs of uncleanliness the smattering of paint on the door and headboard etc from when the room was last painted. This bedroom was small and the bed wasn't really comfortable. There was a TV on the wall which provided freeview - though a £10 deposit had to be left on reception in order to get a remote - and the bathroom, which had a shower, was clean and spacious. But being one level down you had to put up with the constant noise of the underground trains which whizzed by until about midnight, and starting up again after 5am. This wasn't ideal and did interrupt my sleep, but for the price for two of us to stay in London we had no real qualms. The bedroom was right next to the breakfast room, again ideal, and the offer of egg/toast was available from the couple running the small kitchen - who some would say didn't quite know what they were doing - along with the usual croissants, rolls, sesame seed burger buns (!), cereal, tea/coffee/orange juice, biscuits, and cup cakes....! Check out was at 11am and as we weren't planning to leave London until later that day I enquired as to where we could leave out luggage. The only option is to leave it in front of reception, in view of everyone else, and you're given a belt to wrap around it. And as we didn't want to wheel the cases around London we just did it, but made sure no valuables were left in the luggage. We wouldn't rush back to this establishment in any hurry, but for what you pay for in the heart of London then you can't really have any complaints. The staff were extremely friendly and if all you're doing is using the hotel as a base then you'd get by staying at the Hyde Park Court. But make sure you ask if there's a room above basement level available first. The grumbling of the underground is the last thing you need at night after a day of squeezing into these trains.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Think About It!!”
Reviews.Author: In2design
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awful! Unfortunately I was booked into this place for 3 nights with my teenage daughter. Bedroom was so tiny we kept bumping into each other just getting dressed!! Bathroom was beyond belief - if in deed you can call it a bathroom -1sqm in total!! After our first visit to the breakfast room we chose not to return, to say it was filthy would be an understatement, instead we used the local Nero's. The pictures they depict of their hotel are not a true reflection of the actual place - how can this be allowed!! Fortunately my daughter and I have a sense of humour!!!

Reviews.Title: “Desperately in need of refurbishment. Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: falcon1979
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of budget hotels in London (40-60GBP p/night) as an independent contractor who lives out the city these days, and this is one of the worst. The reception looks decent enough. My room shook with the underground passing below and lots of noise from the room above. The bathroom door was off it's hinges and someone had punched it, perhaps in annoyance at the standard of room. The room resembled a second hand furniture store with a strange grease stain on the bedding. The window didn't have a lock and looked out over a grim space between other hotels inhabited by pigeons. The worst though was the dirty carpet which was trimmed with bits of toilet paper in an attempt to keep 'something' out the room. Breakfast was served in the scruffy basement by a young Indian couple who clearly were trying their best. On offer were traditional cakes, cereal and a strange cabinet of bread rolls and pastries. I was then offered fried eggs with beans and toast. It was all edible and was a surprising range, but to be honest they would be better not serving breakfast and instead using the money to refurbish the rooms. In their defence the guy on the room offered me another room upstairs but it was equally bad with the same strange carpet trimmed in toilet roll. My advice to you is to stay at an easyHotel. Same price, no breakfast, but the rooms are clean My advice to the owners is refurbish your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: rambo1968
Reviews.Content: Don't book this hotel. Booked for one night during half term holiday with husband and 8 year old. Thought it would be convenient for station and rest of city and a good price. When arrived room was not ready so had to leave bag at reception and was told by staff that our bag would be taken to the room ready for our return. On return, late after theatre visit, found our bag sitting in the reception area! Not taken to our room as we were told. Luggage store was the open reception area! Having left reception our room was on the lower ground floor. Alarm bells! Hotel close to underground so noise and movement from underground lines very loud. Not the hotels problem, but the worst thing was the smell that greeted us as we walked down the very narrow staircase. Room was very small, smelly, even though the window was open and a fan was at full blast. The shower was open to the room so if was travelling with friends would be quite awkward. The only saving grace was that the sheets were clean. The hotel was full so could not change to other room. If it was not so late and having a tired child I would have changed hotel straight away. Managed to get some sleep on a very small double bed. Breakfast - room very small and guests had to queue for a table. Wouldn't bother. It was embarrassing to think that the European guests were treated to an English breakfast of toast, undercooked fried egg and baked beans. Had to ask three times for toast for my son. If we were staying in London for more nights we would have changed hotels. It spoiled what was a well earned break with the family.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: kimbalweed
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel as part of my boyfriends birthday present. I haven't got much money so i felt lucky to find a central hotel with nice looking rooms (as shown in website photos) and breakfast included, for a decent price. Upon arrival on 10th September I was told that the room was not ready yet and that we could leave our bags with them. We had to tie them together for some reason. We agreed, thinking they would be kept in a safe, locked room but we were told to leave them in front of the front desk, whilst people were constantly entering and leaving the building. We returned to the hotel at 4pm to get changed for a show we were seeing that evening. We were given the key and found our room......in the basement. Our initial impression of the room was that it was small, dirty looking, outdated and dark, with the only window facing the corridor inside so you had to have the curtains closed at all times for privacy and the window closed in case anyone broke in. We tried not to worry about it as we wanted to enjoy our weekend and just thought of t room as just a room and its condition didn't matter. However, we returned to the room at midnight after our evening out and took abit more time to examine the room. The shower curtain was old and dirty Red cushions on the bed were stained Carpet was dusty and had cobwebs all over it Cobwebs behind bed Exposed electrical wiring on fan wire Grill missing off front of fan - could cut off fingers where fan is in motion, which it had to be as the room was so hot. Nothing was PAT tested No television remote Bed bugs/fleas. We were both bitten by something and i squashed two fleas. One in the bed and one in the bathroom Noise from underground trains, guests going along corridor in morning No mirror in bathroom Springs coming through mattress!!! I had to call someone back home to check the tripadvisor website for reviews and there was a review for the room we were staying in. It was a bad review and they had found the same things wrong as we had. I straight away went upstairs to reception to complain and see about getting a different room. The night porter could not help us as he did not have the authority to give us a new room which was fair enough but he promised that the manager would be there in the morning and that we would get a new room then. He was lying. We would have left straight away if we knew we would not get a different room. Breakfast was poor. A small room with dirty wallpaper. We sat down and my boyfriend was offered toast, egg or beans. I was offered nothing. We were brought toast but not given plates so we had to ask for them. The butter, jam and chocolate spread had crumbs and debris in it. We were given cups for tea or coffee but there was no sign of where to fill it.The croissants were out of date. We packed straight away and went to complain to the manager but he was not there. We spoke to someone called Ash who could not give us another room as they were fully booked and could not refund us as we booked through an agency. This meant we had no money to find another hotel and at such short notice we wouldn't be able to anyway. We checked out on the 11th September, 1 day early and had to sleep in our car that night. The room is appalling and i would not expect anyone to stay in it, no matter how desperate they are for a room. I am asking that i am refunded for the 2 nights i was meant to stay as we would have checked out on the 10th but were promised a new room on the 11th. It is the worst hotel i have ever stayed in and am so upset.

Reviews.Title: “Think carefully and believe the reviews before booking !”
Reviews.Author: jusael70
Reviews.Content: When we were booking this hotel we decided not to check the reviews as we thought that people only write reviews if they have something bad to say and not something good. We now wish that we had read the reviews, so please take the time to read our review.......we are giving a very frank account of our stay. We specifically booked this hotel after checking that there was a left luggage room, only to find that the left luggage room was in fact a corner of the reception area (not even behind the reception), this meant leaving our luggage for all and sundry to have a fiddle with if they wanted. I would like to say though that we were given a piece of rope to tie our luggage together (dont quite know why). On checking in we were directed to room B01 (if you are unlucky enough to get this room, I would run immediately as it is the pits). After descending the stairs to the basement, down some very steep and very poorly carpeted stairs (each stair being half the depth of an average foot and the carpet overhung each step so this was very dangerous) we entered room B01..........oh my god, a room for 3, which would probably house 1 person in the real world. There was a small room with a toilet and a basin, which will only house you if you are about 6 stone or less. The worst was yet to come.......there was what was supposed to be a shower which was housed in what was once a cupboard in the middle of the open bedroom (glass shower doors!). Basically, you would have to strip off in front of everyone in the room, have a shower in full view of all your friends, then you would have to get someone to pass you a towel so you could step back into the bedroom to dry off. Realising there would be no privacy whatsoever, and that this was ridiculous, I went upstairs and asked to be given another room. This time we were give B02. A tad better than the other room, a little bit bigger and with a small shower room come toilet. The shower had no tray, but at least it had a door! mold everywhere The kettle didnt work, there was a blood stain on one of the sheets, the windows were all cracked (which was painted over so you could not see out!)_, the net curtains were filthy and way too long, the bed was adorned with fancy cushions that obviosly only get washed on a yearly basis, it was impossible to get enough sleep as the tube station was directly underneath the hotel and all you could hear up til about 12 and from around about 5.30 was the tubes whizzing by and staff in the reception above us (it sounded like they were playing marbles with bolders). The breakfast room was small to say the least, in fact I was embarrased for a larger built lady who had absolutely no chance of getting out of her chair once sat in it (elbow to elbow with people sat next to you). The cereals (choice of rice krispies, cornflakes, museli and cocoa pops) were in dispensers and my 8 year old nearly ate the lid of the dispenser on day one after it fell into her bowl with the cereal!!!!! on the first day the waitress offered toast, beans and egg (offered in that order, individually to each of us seperately)! the second day there was no offer of beans! she smiled a lot though so that was nice. The condiments for the table were spread, jam and nutella, all 3 (seperately) in a silver condiment style holder - obviously scooped out of their original containers and placed into this holder - I just could not face this, I much prefer to see what spreads I am eating - especially as on the second day we were given the condiment holder from the table next to us after the guest had left!!! crumbs and all - yuck No sniff of brown bread, cheap tea bags and sachets of coffee and people sitting outside our room whilst awaiting a table made breakfast an ordeal I have just asked my 8 year old if she wanted to add something to this review and she said 'it stank'. Brilliant location though!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: shamilali51
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Bus stops and under ground stations are very close. The staff is exellent and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The breakfast was nice and the receptionists were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Never again.”
Reviews.Author: HoraceChestwig
Reviews.Content: Very simply, don't stay here. You couldn't swing the proverbial cat in my room. The shower was rammed in - use the curtain and it wraps round you like a bit of wet seaweed, don't use it and the bathroom is soaked. Sheets were clean but I daren't look, or touch the mattress! And the best bit - there was a small roof area outside my room which was the meeting point for all the local pigeons. And they cooed all night. So I couldn't open the window, therefore I turned on the fan which gave a very good impression of a jumbo taking off at the end of my bed! Oh and the other guests ran up and down the corridor, shouting and laughing until about 3 am.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - avoid, avoid, avoid.”
Reviews.Author: katiestatie
Reviews.Content: I arrived here after making a booking online on the Hyde Park Court Hotel website to be told they couldn't find my booking so I had to leave my bags with reception as I was rushing out. Not a great start. Arrived back at the hotel much later on in the evening and checked in properly, I had a room on the 4th floor, a blooming long way up (obviously this isn't there fault but not great all the same!) The bathroom light wouldnt turn on and the toilet was leaking all over the bathroom floor with wet towels on the floor from them trying to stop it - the man from reception came up to look and his solution was to dry the floor with a further towel and leave it there. Apparently the hotel was fully booked so he couldnt move me to a different room and gave me no refund at all. So I had to stay in a room where the bathroom floor was covered with toilet water, what a delight. The one upside of this was its location and the fact the sheets appeared to be clean, other than that it really wasn't at all pleasant and I got out of there as soon as I could.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel??????????????????????????”
Reviews.Author: nrhodes124
Reviews.Content: this is possibly the worst place on earth my tip is you would be better sleeping on a park bench and having a bath in a puddle!

Reviews.Title: “Keep away from this dirty hole!”
Reviews.Author: godzilla1965
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever been to, the only good thing about this is the location. The rooms are tiny, the furniture is used broken down from IKEA, the bathrooms look like they were removed from 50 year old cargo ships! The beds were tiny and matresses so thin, one could feel the springs! They never had enough towels and didn't help at all with requests. The breakfast consisted of old milk, cereal crumbs and socalled english breakfast (fried eggs, beans and toast). On the tables were bowls of margarine (with black hair) old jam and nutella - we ate their once and never came back! If they didn't insist on payment in advance we would have left!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it”
Reviews.Author: DannyVer
Reviews.Content: Ok so we've been to London with a school trip and everything was seriously awesome with this hotel as an exception. I sure do understand the saying "Gettin' your money's worth" cause the hotel is simply crap. It's tiny and is smells like mould all over the place. I had to drag up several suitcases and it's not pleasant for sure. When asking for a first aid kit for a few blisters I was refered to the shop around the corner by the clerk. The service was alright and the rooms themselves were reasonably clean. The location on the other hand was surely perfect just around the corner of the Paddington underground. Nevertheless I wouldn't recommend this to anyone who's not used to anything below a student hostell standard.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, best avoided”
Reviews.Author: Destichado
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, short walking distance from Paddington train station and subway, however all other was much too basic for the price. Room and bathroom were very small, breakfast was more then plain. Definately not for experienced travelers

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that who just spend a litlle time”
Reviews.Author: mr_night
Reviews.Content: It's a four floor hotel with no elevator, everyday it's very tiring up and done the many stairs! The hotel needs works because it's a little old. The bathroom it's the small I ever saw in my life, very difficult to take a bath but have lots of hot water. At night I listen a litlle sound like water falling in ceiling. God bless ear plugs. But last floor it's better for the street sounds, almost zero!:) The people that work in the hotel are very friendly and in the end they offer us a box of chocolates and they were always the first to help us. Everyday at morning they clean the room and give new towels. Breakfast was nice, croissants, toasts, juices, etc. It's enought to feel good. The wifi works great, but you have to pay it! A great price who have laptop. Beds are great, very confortable! I must say amazing beds!:D I went to smoke outside on the roof and I saw old furnitures on the roof, not so good. I don't know if I found for this price a better hotel, mas it's ok to sleep! It's only 3 min walk from the underground.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: mazzolapaulo
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, Warm, secure, easy to find, close to tubes, trains and busses. Good resturants close by. They do not have english breakfast, just continental. But loads of great coffee shops around to get food.

Reviews.Title: “Very small and basic”
Reviews.Author: NandKKent
Reviews.Content: We made the mistake of reading reviews for Hyde Park Hotel not Hyde Park 'Court' Hotel: - Check in easy & smooth - Staff pleasant enough - Room didn't smell very nice - Bathroom/ toilet tiny and smelt musty - Shower was very poor - Double bed was tiny in a very small room - Breakfast was basic but pleasant - Great location

Reviews.Title: “Not for the weak hearted”
Reviews.Author: fionadon
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 4 nights this month and nearly died at the initial task of climbing 63 narrow stairs to the top floor with luggage. This climb is not for the 'weak hearted' and if you are not you could be after your visit. We were told we were upgraded to a family room....well when we walked in I wasnt too sure what a double would look like. It was very small for a family. Just an ok size room for a couple. The hotel itself smelt musty but was clean. Ensuite was a small box, dont expect to be able to move around in the shower or close the door whilst on the toilet. The mattresses on the bed were very thin and you could feel the springs as you slept, if I hadnt already paid for it we would have gone elsewhere. After 4 nights here I had severe back pain...... Breakfast was adequate but on 2 occasions we couldnt be bothered waiting for the dining room to have a free table so ate outside. Location is good for travel around London on a short trip and also for access to Heathrow via the express or connect trains. As someone has previously written it is adequate enough but not comfortable and only for sleeping in, you wouldnt want to sepnd any time there other than sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: LondonArch
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of not reading the trip advisor reviews and everyone of the poor scores recevied is deserved. We were scheduled to stay here for one night before catching an early morning train to Heathrow from Paddington. It was a last minute booking having found the hotel on a blackberry search. Upon arrival we were allocated a room on the top floor and when you have no lift, plenty of luggage and a tight staircase it was not easy reaching the summit. The room and bathroom was dirty and smelt so we walked back down the stairs dropped off the key and headed to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute pits”
Reviews.Author: UkCm1
Reviews.Content: This is the worst London hotel I have ever stayed in - avoid, avoid, avoid. When we arrived, late at night, the receptionist had gone out and locked the door. We waited 20 minutes outside with a small child and baby and he was so rude when he returned. The public areas were tatty and dirty and the room was basic in the extreme. Our room, supposedly a family room, had two beds 'upstairs' and one at the bottom with a lethal, open tread spiral staircase in between - completely unsafe for small children. Staff were unhelpful and the room was overpriced. We didn't risk breakfast knowing it would be awful. There's an easyhotel a few metres away that would be a much, much better budget option.

Reviews.Title: “second time around, not so good, see previous review”
Reviews.Author: joe90gt
Reviews.Content: second time of staying for us, not so good this time, different family room on front of hotel so a bit noisier at night but nice birdsong in the morning, beds and room about the same but toilet not so good, large hole behind wc and leaking from base of pan made it smell and look bit evil. Shower still great but no hot water until 18.00 which meant getting ready to go out was a bit of a rush, caravan type onsuite so still as cramped but seems to be standard for the rate, breakfast fine, just get down early otherwise you'll have to wait. Location obviously still great !!. TBH I spend as little time as poss in a hotel in LDN as I don't want to waste my valuable holiday time, as long as its basically clean and comfy thats fine, shame about the WC , otherwise it would have rated higher

Reviews.Title: “Ever had a portaloo in your bedroom!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kmaxx
Reviews.Content: In brief, it no doubt once was a lovely Georgian House in a great area with massively high ceilings . It's now a bottom end hotel in a not so good area, with what feels like massive over occupancy. £70 online for a twin room which really was a single. The beds were extra thin and even at that it only left a foot in-between them. The 'en-suite' was a plastic portaloo style cubicle constructed beside the door. Functional if you are a midget. Don't expect to sit on the loo with the door closed of have a shower in an un-contorted manner. The dinning room is actually in the basement and about the same size as the bedroom. Breakfast was simple, cereals, toast, 2 hour old boiled eggs and self service everything. The main public use bathroom is on the 1st floor. In my hour of need after checking out, I paid it a hasty visit. Upon completion of the task, to my peril, there was no toilet roll. After a bit of necessary water splashing I then found there was no soap. Nor was there a towel. So hands and backsides dripping, I proceeded down the stairs to let the management know of my predicament. In short, would I go back, probably, but only out of necessity. There is a sort of innocence about the place which makes it easy to forgive it's shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: rangers02
Reviews.Content: What a joke. This should be named the Steptoe Special. We arrived and immediately saw the wallpaper falling off the wall in the reception area, Then we saw the sign on first and second floor with the missing letters on the plaques. When we got into our room, we saw 1940 furniture. The "En-suite" was in the wardrobe approx 7ft x 3ft. When you opened the door you had to stand up onto a plastic tray which rocked and when you sat on the loo, your head was in the basin. The water was cold as was the shower. The radiator was not switched on and after an evening out in the west end to see a show,we returned soaking wet from the torrential rain and for the second time, we could not enter the hotel from the outside door. The 2 bells did not work and the man behind the reception took half an hour to hear the banging of our knocks on the outside door, as he was asleep. The beds had springs sticking out of the mattresses and the bedding was a sheet, blanket and a throw. Not a duvet. 3 star hotel my eye! 3rd rate yes, 1 star only. We would not even go there again, and never recommend it to anyone. It ought to be checked out by the tourist information board and trading standards. We just wanted to go home or find another hotel of better quality, but could not afford it. Foreigners must haved a total shock and think feel this is our best hotels. Its embarrassing.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: Ruffles1980
Reviews.Content: Review of room 304: Pro's: - Clean bedding - Good location - Reasonable breakfast (croissants, cereal, juices, tea/coffee, water melon) Con's - Tiny room - 4" wide "Double Mattress" on a single divan base - Minuscule, dirty shower room - Broken hairdryer We paid £75 for 1 night so my expectations weren't too high, but I do expect a decent bed and a clean bathroom. I'm adamant you could do far better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Bathroom & Sheetless Bed for GBP 55 _ ARGGGHHHH!”
Reviews.Author: mark_ncompass
Reviews.Content: If like me you did not think that the other reviews here provided a balanced view of the Hyde Park Court Hotel in Norfolk Square Paddington - Beware They Do ! The place is an absolute dump. We made the mistake of believing the [---] on their website and booked by phone direct and regretted it. When we discovered how bad it was we spent hours searching the local streets for vacancies without success and had to stay in the place - ARGH. Some of the local hoteliers were even more sorry for us when they realised that we were trying to escape from the Hyde Park Court - it appears that the hotel has a reputation! Whats wrong? Well here's a brief summary of the issues with our room (55 GBP / Night): The double bed was against the wall because no room available for access both sides; No bedside tables at all as no room for them; Bathroom is a plastic unit (like a caravan) built into the room - it is tiny (see picture); You cannot wipe your bum with the door closed, it has to be open; The wash hand basin is IN the shower cubicle; The tap set for the shower is at shoulder level on the side wall of the shower and scalds you if touched; The shower cubicle is approx 75mm wider than the average male's shoulders (you will be scalded at least once); The bed did not have a fitted bottom sheet just a single sheet that did not reach the sides so it could not be tucked in; Only two pillows the depth of ice cream wafers provided - request for extra pillows were met with offers of spare towels (no pillows); Bedding appears to have been purchased from other hotels that were refitted in the 70s / 80s, and quilt cover had evidence of rodent attack; Only 4 hand towels provided (no bath towels) after complaints eventually two bath towels were provided to supplement the pillows; The noise and vibration of every tube train kept you awake; Using the TV to hide the noise was of limited value as eventually you had to get up anyway because the TV had no remote control; The room was very hot despite temps outside below 10C; The ventilation fan provided only worked on slow and because only one power point could only be on when the TV was off; The hotel claims to be adjacent to Hyde Park - they are actually at least 15 minutes walk away with the closest point being Lancaster Gate - take everything said on their website with a pinch of salt. I would only book here if you can gaurantee alternative available accommodation if you are not satisfied AND you are not forced into paying in advance, otherwise DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable - Still crying now.”
Reviews.Author: KazzieDevon
Reviews.Content: Our Room was so small you could hardly move. The bedcovers were dreadful - Why we stayed the night I do not know - but we had little choice - The toilet smelt and as someone has so rightly said was barely bigger than a portaloo. Breakfast consisted of cereal and a roll so dry you couldn't eat it. Everyone was throwing them away. An experience I would never want to repeat. I am not a fussy person and believe that you get what you pay for, but how they get away with these conditions as far as environmental health are concerned I do not know.

Reviews.Title: “rats in room”
Reviews.Author: KedgarDerby
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 2 night stey - 3 adults, one 3yr old. The website was interactive and looked very impressive - this was completely deceitful!!! it was a shambles. We left after the first night and these are the reasons..... the entrance was disappointing - very shabby, dirty and disgusting. The reception desk was cracked and the staff were quite unhelpful when there was a problem. One lady in our party was 30 weeks pregnant and we had a 3yr old child with us and we were on the 4th floor - no-one offered help at all. The room was small and dirty, my nephew found the two mouldy maltesers underneath the cupboards. The bathroom was a dirty plastic shell in the corner of the room and offered limited hot water. The television did not work and the room STANK! We were disturbed by the train noise, which runs directly underneath the hotel and rattled windows and furniture alike. The room was cold - due to the inadequate heating and considering the fact that we had a three yr old child with us the metre wide sash window which fell directly onto the street and could not be locked meant we couldn't relax the whole time we were there. The breakfast was inadequate and the staff were arguing between themselves. This was not the only reason we left after our first night - we were woken at 5.40am by rats in our bedroom - that's right...RATS!! Brilliant, especially for a preggers lady and 3yr old!! We moved to the chrysos hotel opposite - couldn't be more helpful - they were wonderful!! if you do decide to stay at the Hyde park then good luck...you'll need it!

Reviews.Title: “Cheating!!!”
Reviews.Author: IsraelElla
Reviews.Content: The description that based on information provided by the hotel is misleading and dishonest. The rooms that are not appropriate for people - the toilet is less than 40 cm from the bed and there is not enough room for suitcase to be brought into the room. There is something written in arabic in reception - no translation. This place couldn't be called a "hotel" It was very awful experience, we left because it was impossible to stay (credit card was charged) and we had to look for another available hotel at late evening hours. There is strong feeling that this hotel makes its profit by charging "no show charge"?

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sidlad
Reviews.Content: hotel location was superb every thing was on easy access. as i was traveling with children i was woried for safety but foud the hotel and area safe and child friendly. Hotel Staff was very friendly and cooperative as they changed our room from 3rd floor to 1st floor, which was very nice with 2 level and children being on upper level we had a bit of a privacy. Breakfast was the way we like it i.e. simple and light. We enjoyed our our 5 day stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Our Flea infested nightmare in Hell!”
Reviews.Author: purplemocco
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel, the Hyde Park Court hotel, Norfolk Sq, for one night. On checking in they made us pay upfront. Then when we had paid our money they informed us that our room was a 5 minute drive away! We argued with the man behind reception that we didnt want to be moved anywhere. He assurred us that they were booked out and that we'd have to go to these rooms. The place they sent us was a hell hole. The name of the place was the Whiteleaf Hotel, Bayswater. It is a flea infested, disgusting hotel. Rentokil poison in the bedrooms, fleas all over the beds. We have never experienced such a dump. At 5am after arguing with the hotel and calling the police we eventually got moved. So be warned - If you book the Hyde Park Hotel, Norfolk Square you cold potentially be staying in any dump around London. A cardboard box would be cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here”
Reviews.Author: cosmofountain
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the internet ( not a well known hotel booking site). When we arrived we paid in full and as soon as the money was handed over we were told we were staying in a sister hotel a five minute drive away.. Obviousy we argued until we realised the second hotel was closer to where we were going that evening. The hotel we were taken to looked ok in the beginning. At 3.30 am we woke to realise we were being attacked by bed bugs. There were cockroaches in the bathroom and mouse traps under the bed. It was a horrible experience. We had to leave the hotel at 4am as one of the group had been bitten quite badly.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't call it a "hotel" never again!”
Reviews.Author: londongal58
Reviews.Content: The location of this b&b was ok as it was near bus stops,shops etc. The bathroom was like a portaloo - and smelled like one aswell! There was no lifts in this building and our room was on the 4th floor so you can imagine trying to drag a suitcase up 80 steps - yes we counted them, and trying to get your luggage down them again was quite dangerous. So if you have children with you or bad joints or getting on in years this place would not be suitable unless you were guaranteed a room on ground level. If we were going out sight seeing we tried to aviod going back to the hotel to avoid hard slogs up the stairs so we stayed out for as long as possible! The breakfast room was tiny - only 5 tables so if they were all being used you had to wait. Also the staff didn't speak good english. The food at breakfast was ok, not a lot of choice just cereal and a bun but i suppose for the money you pay it was ok. This place would be ok if you were just staying for one night but i would not recommend it for a full weekend stay. Truly awful place.

Reviews.Title: “awful..do not stay here at any cost!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: headchef
Reviews.Content: A shocking waste of money and would not recommend it to anyone. double ensuite room was so small we couldn't even move around the bed and the ensuite was literally no bigger than a toilet you would find in a plane! there was no hot water and when i asked at the reception they told me to "use the kettle" As both me and my wife work in the hotel and catering trade we have stayed in some fantastic hotels but i would never concider staying at this hotel again. Read the reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in april and i am really kicking my self why i booked the hotel is so badly run that the moment i enter it i was thinking where i came, the gave me the room in the basement and you can hear when people are walking the room is smelly and the bathroom looks like just taken from the construction site, you have to pay on arrival with out seeing the room, and know i can understand why is that, the recpionist is so rude and don't know about anything, when asked, the manager isn't help ful either saying that cannot move me if i want to move i have to pay extra, the breakfast was horriable and unhygenic, thankfuly i checked out and find some decent place to stay. my advise to everyone stay away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We styaed in this hotel last September for two nights and was veru disappointed with standard of accommodation we recieved. We found the room not very clean and the bathroom as well. The bathroom was also very small and it would take about half an hour for the hot water to heat up. I'm serious! Breakfast was included in the rate but you're better off skipping what they serve you altogether. Stale cereal and bread with tea/coffee. Staff were nice enough though but I'm sure you could definitely find better accommodation in London for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: LCMey
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worst accomodation I have ever stayed at. The room was filthy, with rips and stains, including blood, on the bedspreads. The bathroom smelled like an open sewer and even with the one window propped open over night and the fan going, we could not use the bathroom except for emergencies. The smell was even coming from the shower drain! The photos on line looked nothing like the reality. The price included breakfast, however we were afraid to eat here considering the lack of cleanliness in the room. Stay away! It is better to pay a bit more and feel comfortable and clean. I would not even recommend this property to a low budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Only recommended when tight budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked according to the webpage, which shows the rooms very different and not like they are in reality. Bed was quite old, same as all interiors include of the bathroom. Room and bathroom where very small and only 1 towel per person. Only small staircases, no lift, and no smoke detectors inside rooms. No hangers in whatsoever way. There was a waterboiler with coffee and teabags, but when opened the waterboiler there was old water inside together with lime inside swimming. Don't know how long it was inside. Rooms have to be paid in advance. If front rooms, nice view to small park. Quiet street, though only 2 min walk to shops/restaurants and 3 min walk to Paddington station. Breakfast was very simple. Staff was friendly, but not "overfriendly". Can only recommend, if budget is very tight. Overall athmosphere was not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, Never Go !!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of, if not, the worst I have ever experienced, you should never go there! Hotel dirty, small rooms without window, underground noise, mattress very old, dirty and very uncomfortable (we felt all the springs!), full payment required at check-in before showing rooms!!!! The website does not show the realty. The breakfast is poor. The prices are overestimated since we obtained a reduction of 35 % in 5 minutes! When we get back from dinner, we found the door of our room opened !! Fortunately, nothing was stolen...

HotelInfo.Name: Hyde Park Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 48 Norfolk Square | Westminster, London W2 1RT, England
